snippet: Japan recalled its ambassador from Seoul on Friday after President Lee Myung-bak of South Korea flew to a set of islets claimed by both countries.
abstract: President Lee Myung-bak of South Korea flies to a set of islets locked in a territorial dispute with Japan, dismissing protests from Tokyo and making a trip that is bound to heighten diplomatic tensions between Washington’s two key Asian allies; he is the first South Korean president to travel there to highlight his country’s territorial control; a squadron of armed South Korean police officers have manned the islets, called Dokdo in Korea and Takeshima in Japan, since the 1950s.
lead_paragraph: Japan recalled its ambassador from Seoul on Friday after President Lee Myung-bak of South Korea flew to a set of islets claimed by both countries.

headline.seo: South Korean President Visits Disputed Islets
headline.main: South Korean’s Visit to Disputed Islets Angers Japan
headline.print_headline: South Korean Leader’s Trip to Islets Strains Japan Ties
